Interface Task

All Superinterfaces:
Resource

extends Resource

public TaskStatus getTaskStatus()
Returns the taskStatus of the task, for example, whether it is active, has completed or failed.

getTaskStatusMessage

public java.lang.String getTaskStatusMessage()
Returns the message associated with the last taskStatus. If no message associated with last taskStatus, returns null.

Returns:
The task status message

isTaskLive

public boolean isTaskLive()
Returns true if this task is still live, false otherwise. See TaskStatus for more information.

Returns:
True if the task is live, false otherwise

getTaskAttributes

public java.util.List getTaskAttributes()
Returns the list of additional attributes associated with the task. In general, these task attribute methods are provided for users that wish to specify information in addition to the information represented by the task interface.

Returns:
The list of task attributes

getTaskAttribute

public TaskAttribute getTaskAttribute(java.lang.String name)
Returns the task attribute with the given name. Returns null if no task attribute exists with the given name. In general, these task attribute methods are provided for users that wish to specify information in addition to the information represented by the task interface.

Parameters:
name - The name of the task attribute
Returns:
The task attribute.

public java.lang.String getTaskAttributeValue(java.lang.String name)

Parameters:
name - The name of the task attribute
Returns:

putTaskAttribute

public TaskAttribute putTaskAttribute(java.lang.String name,
                                      java.lang.String value)
Adds the given task name value pair as a task attribute. Returns the task attribute that the method creates. In general, these task attribute methods are provided for users that wish to specify information in addition to the information represented by the task interface.

Parameters:

value - The value of the task attribute
Returns:

removeTaskAttribute

public TaskAttribute removeTaskAttribute(java.lang.String name)
Removes the task attribute with the given name. Returns the task attribute that was removed. In general, these task attribute methods are provided for users that wish to specify information in addition to the information represented by the task interface.

Parameters:
name - The name of the task attribute
Returns:
The task attribute that was removed

clearTaskAttributes

public void clearTaskAttributes()
Clears all the additional attributes associated with this task. In general, these task attribute methods are provided for users that wish to specify information in addition to the information represented by the task interface.

getTaskMetrics

public java.util.List getTaskMetrics()
Returns the list of metrics associated with the task. For example, the rate at which a file transfer is occuring. Not all task types have taskMetrics associated with them, however, in which case this should return an empty list.

Returns:
The list of task metrics
See Also:
TaskMetric

getTaskMetric

public TaskMetric getTaskMetric(java.lang.String name)
Returns the metric with the given name.

Parameters:
name - The name of the task metric
Returns:
The task metric

hasTaskMetrics

public boolean hasTaskMetrics()
Returns true if the task has taskMetrics that can be monitored.

Returns:
True if has task metrics, false otherwise

Returns the date this task was submitted.

Returns the date this task first became active.

Returns:

getDateTaskStatusChanged

public java.util.Date getDateTaskStatusChanged()
Returns the date the taskStatus of this task last changed.

Returns:

getDateTaskEnded

public java.util.Date getDateTaskEnded()
Returns the date this task ended (i.e. completed, canceled, or failed)

Returns:
The date the task ended

getDeleteWhenTaskEndsFlag

public boolean getDeleteWhenTaskEndsFlag()
Returns true if this task should delete it's own record when it ends. This is useful when it is not desired to keep a record of a task.

Returns:
True if the task should be deleted when it is done, false otherwise.

waitFor

public void waitFor()
             throws TaskException
Waits for the task to end (i.e. isTaskLive() == false)

Throws:
TaskException
